page.title: 02Landscape
page.content: The area has undulating landscape which rises from the Oxford Clay vale to the south to a ridge of boulder clay in the west.The ridge has a plateau- like top (on part of which is the Cranfield airfield to the south -west out of this area ) and although there is more arable farming here now that in the past the area still retains much pastoral farming and there is more tree and hedgerow cover than in surrounding areas. The area is therefore, less open, but fine views can be gained from the ridge at Bourne End, looking in a north -easterly direction across to the Bedford urban area and beyond.There is some woodland,Wootton Woods and Longcroft Spinney which are part of a line of ancient oak and ash woods in this area.
